comments.body: Nit: Can we confirm that `list_artifacts()` *does* contain `path_a`, `path_b`, etc before we call `delete`?
Good point, I will insert an assert before confirming this.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +246,250 @@
    repo.delete_artifacts()
    tmpdir_objects = repo.list_artifacts()
    assert not tmpdir_objects

comments.body:
I think the artifacts list should be empty after deletion, right?

Also, the `path` attributes of artifact info returned by `list_artifacts` refer to run-relative artifact paths (e.g., `"a.txt"` rather than `path_a`. (See https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/rest-api.html#fileinfo)

> I think the artifacts list should be empty after deletion, right?
Again, right :). Just checking that the list is empty should be enough, instead of 3 asserts. 

I will provide an update soon.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +246,250 @@
    repo.delete_artifacts()
    tmpdir_objects = repo.list_artifacts()
    assert not tmpdir_objects

comments.body:
Hi @sklingel :) Thank for the PR!

This is a nit but can we fix this line as follows?

```python
assert tmpdir_objects == []
```

because any falsy object (e.g., 0, "", None, (), False) can pass `assert not tmpdir_objects` + this clarifies that we expect an empty list here (rather than a falsey object). I'd be happy to review a follow-up PR.
I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s necessary. We have separate test coverage for the return type / behavior of list artifacts. We also use falsey object comparison of this form throughout other test suites.

Ok makes senes :)

@sklingel Sorry for the confusion ðŸ˜…
